comment: It's great if you want to learn about how to get drunk in the middle of a park.

Had Professor Allsup for a Saturday morning class, he's honestly one of the least dependable teachers I've ever had. Extended homework dates after the class had submitted already, cancelled class for personal reasons, showed up late every weekend, and failed to post course schedule or lecture notes (unless you emailed to remind him) DO NOT TAKE. :(
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: THIS IS AN AMAZING PROFESSOR.  Even if you have to take him on a Saturday DO IT! He will help you ALL the time with whatever you need. He makes this class fun and enjoyable. He will help you out if you work hard and he's definitely here for the students and nothing else. TAKE HIM YOU WILL NOT REGRET THIS.

Easiest accounting professor ever. He's young and understands the way we work and jokes around in class. Tests aren't too bad either. MAKE SURE to go to class the day after tests. He allowed for test corrections once and many people missed it. In the end I needed a 30 on the final to make an A in the class. Take him!
Professor Allsup is a cool dude. Lots of homework on connect, as with any accounting class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great professor. Take him. Go to class, do all assigments, study for exams, you'll get an A. He's more concerned with your effort then your grades.
Instructor Allsup is very nice, funny, and knowledgeable. Take him! He's awesome. Make sure to study for your tests and read before you come to class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--Respected by students

comment: Great professor. Gives one extra credit assignment at the end that is hard as all hell but can make an 86 B turn into an A. This was my case. Assignment took me six hours to complete. Overall he is a great professor who will work with you if you need help. A+++

Based on the reviews from previous semesters I expected an easy A. That was not the case. The extra credit opportunities only totaled 2.5% of the points. I did well in the course and enjoyed almost every class. Some material was just outright boring. it is accounting after all.
I think he would be better suited for more advanced courses. Overall, he is a great professor and pretty funny.
The pace of the class was intense compared to other courses I have taken.  The best part of his class is the material he covers that isn't in the book.

This is probably the best class I have taken so far at KSU.  Although, I am not pursuing an Accounting Degree...I enjoyed this course.  We discussed a lot topics outside of Accounting.  Professor Allsup taught about student achievement and how college is only a stepping stone to being successful.

Professor Allsup is easygoing and teaches with a lot of passion. We covered a lot of current events which made the course enjoyable. It is nice having a Professor who teaches from reality and not just a textbook.

He goes over the tests in detail before the actual test so if you show up, you should be more than fine for the exams. He is one of my favorite professors in my three and a half years at KSU. He cares about how his students do in the class and really enjoys teaching.

He teaches with a lot of passion toward accounting and continuous improvement.  He is not a lifelong professor, so he seems to provide a better perspective than teachers with no real world experience.  I wish he taught more courses.

Awesome class. Attendance and paying attention to the newsfeed updates on D2L are important. Professor Allsup provides a lot of real-world examples that make the content relatable. The way some of the test questions are worded can be confusing. I found myself overthinking on the exams.
Lived of extra credit

Relevant content, easy to understand, and concerned with overall student success. The examples he used to were much easier to understand than the textbook. Take him, but he only teaches in the evening.

I decided to pursue an accounting degree after his course. He took time outside of class to go through the opportunities available within the profession. His teaching style is laid back, but sometimes tries to fit too much into one class.

Made an A in the class, but I don't feel like I learned much in this class. Seems to teach more off of his professional experience and uses terminology an intro class wouldn't know. Tests were tough, if you don't know the material, it'll mock you in 5 other identical questions.
If you want an easy A take him. If Acct is your major then don't take him. I got an A because of ton of extra point. he gives tone of extra point.
very bad teacher stay away. do not take him.
He is a very bad teacher. he does not teach give back your test very late. Don't take him.

The way that he lectures is very unclear.  I know that he understands the subject because he is very enthusiastic about it. But for the students that are taking this course for the first time, this is a new subject matter to us.  Instead of letting out of class early, maybe he should take the time to go over the material more.

Allsup is a nice guy however his teaching is very unorganized he never posts things when he says he will... he offers a good amount of extra credit but in the end he never added a few of mine on .. I would look for someone else ..

Allsup is a nice guy, but one of the worst professors I have ever had.  He is an easy professor so if you want an easy A then take him. However, he does nothing more than quickly read the powerpoint slides.  He is late for class almost everyday.  I feel like I have had to teach myself everything. He is late on posting grades and assignments.

go to class and you will at least get a B. It is probably the easiest class I have ever taken but you have to go to class to make it easy. Professer Allsup is very laid back. Reads right off of power point slides. Book not needed and plenty of extra credit.

Overall nice professor, however the tests were harder than the material in the power points. The book ironically is not much help either and your best bet is to use the online book instead. If you already know a good bit of accounting this class should not be too hard if you're almost clueless on the matter or about average do not take this class.

If you want a "cool" teacher this is your guy. If you plan on actually learning anything or an accounting major, Probably not the best pick.He gives lots of bonus on test.He makes the class seem so elementary then the test are hard.He reads straight from power points, if something is worded weird he will just say"ehh let's just go w/ it"-easy A.
Very nice professor willing to work with his students. Willing to give extra credit to his students! I would recommend this professor nice and willing to work with you

Prof. Allsup is a nice guy who seems to be knowledgeable about the subject, but the tests are way too hard! The level of difficulty was disproportionate to the amount of attention devoted to the concepts. He needs to do more than just read off PowerPoints. I only got an A because he gave out copious amounts of bonus points, saving me from a C.

Totally agree with 2 previous comments. 90% of the class would have failed if not for all the extra credits. Also I felt like the exams had questions that were not even covered. Add this to the previous 2 comments and that is the perfect picture for this class.
